key_title: Key to the subspecies of Grevillea victoriae

Key to the families of Dicotyledons

Key to the species of Grevillea

leads.lead_text: Leaves usually narrowly elliptic to lanceolate (rarely oblanceolate), (30–)40–120 mm long, (8–)10–25(–50) mm wide, leaf length to width ratio (3:1–)4:1–5:1(–6:1); leaf margins shortly recurved; leaf upper surface not microscopically asperulous (x 40), usually dull; leaf lower surface usually densely sericeous or occasionally subsericeous, indumentum tidy with mutually aligned, appressed hairs (only with the occasional ascending or suberect ferruginous hairs); leaf lower surface reticulum absent or obscure; floral rachis (17–)40–90 mm long

Leaves usually elliptic to narrowly elliptic or rarely ovate, (20–)35–100(–135) mm long, (7–)15–37 mm wide, leaf length to width ratio 2.25:1–4:1(–5:1); leaf margins shortly flat or very shortly recurved (occasionally rolled or revolute); leaf upper surface glabrous and smooth or occasionally microscopically asperulous (but smooth to touch), sub-glossy; leaf lower surface very densely subsericeous or subtomentose, indumentum slightly messy; leaf lower surface reticulum usually conspicuous or prominent; floral rachis (8–)10–50(–60) mm long
